vermicompost.title: Vermicompost (Worm Compost)
vermicompost.desc: Nutrient-rich organic manure produced using earthworms. Improves soil structure, water retention, and microbial activity.

steps.1: Prepare a shaded bin with small holes for drainage; add a 2‚Äì3 cm layer of dry leaves as bedding.
steps.2: Start with cow dung mixed with kitchen/vegetable waste; avoid citrus, oily, and spicy waste.
steps.3: Introduce earthworms (Eisenia fetida or local species) and keep the pile moist (not wet).
steps.4: Harvest the dark, crumbly compost in 45‚Äì60 days; use 2‚Äì5 kg per plant depending on size.

neem_oil.title: Neem Oil Spray
neem_oil.desc: Natural insect growth regulator effective against aphids, whiteflies, and mites.
neem_oil.mix: Mix 5‚Äì10 ml cold-pressed neem oil with 1 liter water + few drops of mild soap/emulsifier.
neem_oil.application: Spray on both sides of leaves in the evening; avoid hot midday sun.
neem_oil.frequency: Repeat every 7‚Äì10 days, or after rains, until pests are controlled.

garlic_chili.title: Garlic‚ÄìChili Bio-Pesticide
garlic_chili.desc: Repels sucking and chewing insects with a strong natural extract.

steps.1: Grind 100 g garlic + 50 g green chilies with little water.
steps.2: Ferment covered for 24 hours; strain and store the extract.
steps.3: Dilute 30‚Äì40 ml extract per 1 liter water; add a few drops of soap.
steps.4: Spray in the evening; avoid contact with eyes and wash hands after use.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: Can I mix these sprays together?
faq.a1: Avoid mixing initially. Test separately to check plant sensitivity.
faq.q2: When should I spray for best results?
faq.a2: Spray in the evening on both sides of leaves and repeat as needed.
